definition: to have no strength/to feel weak/exhausted/feeling listless/boring/of no interest
erhua variant of 沒勁|没劲[mei2 jin4]

sentences.english: Some 28 percent of adolescents say they are too tired to exercise, due to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 28%的年輕人表示，由於睡眠不足而沒勁兒運動。

sentences.english: Smart personal finance is boring, too.
sentences.chinese: 聰明的個人理財書都很沒勁。

sentences.english: The film is so boring that I walked out mid-way through it.
sentences.chinese: 這部電影真沒勁，我看了一半就出來了。

sentences.english: If I wasn’t enjoying a piece, I stopped reading it.
sentences.chinese: 如果我讀一段沒勁，就會停下來。

sentences.english: The conclusion of the movie was anticlimactic.
“Like a slug,” Marina says flatly. “It’s disgusting.”
sentences.chinese: “像個鼻涕蟲，”瑪麗娜沒勁地說，“很噁心。”

sentences.english: Well Culture is important but by comparision of military history its boring.
sentences.chinese: 是的，文化是很重要，但是和軍事史一比就太沒勁了。

sentences.english: That would be great. The party won't be fun without WangLe.
sentences.chinese: 太好了，沒有王樂聚會就沒勁了。

sentences.english: Doing this just makes you boring and predictable.
sentences.chinese: 沒有主見只會讓人感覺你這人既沒勁又沒什麼深度。

sentences.english: A:I find my job extremely boring these days.
sentences.chinese: 最近我覺得工作非常沒勁。

sentences.english: A woman goes to her doctor complaining that she is exhausted all the time.
sentences.chinese: 一個女人去看醫生，說她一直渾身沒勁兒。

sentences.english: The party won't be fun without you .

definition: everything in disorder (idiom); in a hideous mess/at sixes and sevens
modal particle indicating indicating lack of enthusiasm/modal particle indicating that things should only or can only be done a certain way
to chant/see 梵唄|梵呗[fan4 bai4]
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
to play/to have fun/to hang out
easy to deal with/not a problem/(polite answer) you flatter me
Brothers!/brethren/dude (colloquial)/brother (diminutive form of address between males)
variant of 裝屄|装屄[zhuang1 bi1]
see 他媽的|他妈的[ta1 ma1 de5]
